intro: Trichera cuspidata, commonly known as the spiky poinsettia, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It is characterized by its vibrant red bracts that surround small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is known for its striking appearance during the holiday season. It thrives in warm, humid environments and requires well-draining soil. Trichera cuspidata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its ornate foliage and seasonal color display.
